variation.name: LinkbaseRefCounterExample
variation.description: 201.01 The LinkbaseRef elements MUST hold the URI of Linkbases. In this case the URI's do not resolve to XML documents.

variation.name: LinkbaseRef
variation.description: 201.02 The LinkbaseRef elements hold the URI of Linkbases. In this case the URI's actually resolve to documents that contain the right kinds of XBRL linkbases.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefXMLBase
variation.description: 201.03 XML Base must be used to process the URI of a LinkbaseRef. In this case the schema use the xml base attribute to get the linkbase to be picked up from the base directory instead of the current directory.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefLabelCounterExample
variation.description: 201.04 The LinkbaseRef XLink role attribute value must match the linkbase found at its target. In this case it does not. The role indicates a label linkbase and the actual linkbase is a reference linkbase.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefReferenceCounterExample
variation.description: 201.05 The LinkbaseRef element role must match the linkbase found at its target. In this case it does not. The role indicates a reference linkbase and the actual linkbase is a label linkbase.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefDefinitionCounterExample
variation.description: 201.06 The LinkbaseRef element role must match the linkbase found at its target. In this case a calculation linkbase is indicated and a definition linkbase is provided.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefPresentationCounterExample
variation.description: 201.07 The LinkbaseRef element role must match the linkbase found at its target. In this case a definition linkbase is indicated and a presentation linkbase is provided.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefCalculationCounterExample
variation.description: 201.08 The LinkbaseRef element role must match the linkbase found at its target. In this case a presentation linkbase is indicated and a calculation linkbase is provided.

variation.name: LinkbaseRefMultipleExample
variation.description: 201.09 There can be any number of LinkbaseRef elements having the same role but the role must always match the target.

variation.name: InvalidRefInSecondAppinfo
variation.description: 201.10 The LinkbaseRef element in the second appinfo section holds the URI of a reference linkbase, but uses a role that should only point to label Linkbases.
